Scarlett.Action: Speaks to the camera with a mischievous grin, showing humor and openness about her dangerous mission.
Slumps low in her seat for privacy and cautiously lowers her veil, indicating carefulness and respect for local customs.
Carefully lowers her veil to reveal her identity while maintaining alertness and privacy on a risky journey inside Iran.
Records a detailed and clear message explaining her mission and the risks involved, demonstrating awareness and preparation.
Acknowledges the severe consequences of trespassing but proceeds anyway with a confident and mischievous attitude.
Smiles appreciatively at Reza's wife revealing the hidden entrance, showing gratitude and friendliness.
Follows Reza and his wife into their home and accepts their help without hesitation, indicating trust and tolerance.
Prepares to defend herself by grabbing a rock when hiding from the armed guard, showing cautiousness but not aggression.
Carefully follows Reza through a dangerous marketplace and prepares to enter a hidden hole in the floor, showing awareness and readiness.
Shines flashlight into the dark cave and quickly adapts to the low, cramped environment by crouching and moving cautiously.
Grabs a rock as a potential weapon when they hear approaching guards, demonstrating quick thinking and preparedness.
Refuses to leave despite risk, insists on staying with Reza.
Expresses admiration for the ancient inscriptions, reads them aloud quietly.
Throws veil off her head anxiously, disrupting the camera angle.
Chisels away at the inscriptions despite Reza's warnings, risking detection.
Checks her watch to estimate time left before caves are blown up, showing situational awareness.
Insists on continuing despite risks and Reza's objections, demonstrating determination and confidence.
Reads ancient inscriptions aloud in an ancient tongue, indicating skill and knowledge.
Throws off her veil to adjust the camera angle despite the risk, showing adaptability and focus on the task.
Hacks away at the inscriptions with a rock despite warnings, risking detection and possibly jeopardizing the mission.
Frantically looks around and acts impulsively under pressure, which could be seen as less controlled or strategic.
Pushes away Reza who wants to leave, insisting she will catch up because she has been searching for the statue all her life.
Methodically scans the statue for future study despite danger, showing dedication but no direct interaction with others.
Leaves Reza behind who has a family and runs off, showing disregard for his concerns.
Recognizes the significance of the statue immediately upon seeing it.
Uses a specialized scanning device methodically to capture detailed data of the statue despite increasing danger.
Pushes away Reza's attempt to escort her to safety, choosing to stay and complete her work despite imminent threat.
Works painfully slow to ensure every detail is captured, showing thoroughness but risking personal safety.
Runs away only after completing the scan, demonstrating good timing and awareness of danger.
Calls out urgently for Reza after slamming into something, showing concern for others' safety.
Collapses coughing but holds up the scanner to show success, indicating determination but limited direct warmth.
Speaks directly and confidently to the camera about her discovery, with a smile.
Keeps racing forward despite danger, successfully retrieves the scanner, climbs into the light after the rope ladder drops.
Collapses coughing after escaping but still holds up the scanner triumphantly.
Introduces herself confidently on camera, listing multiple advanced degrees, language fluencies, and a blackbelt in Krav Maga.
Benji comments he has yet to see her do anything, implying a lack of demonstrated competence in action.
Describes Nicolas Flamel’s generosity in donating orphanages and hospitals that still stand today.
Focuses intensely on her quest for lost alchemical knowledge, showing little else beyond that.
Explains the history and significance of alchemy and Nicolas Flamel with clear knowledge and confidence.
Focuses exclusively on her quest for lost alchemical knowledge, showing little engagement in other activities.
Shares personal family tragedy openly, showing vulnerability about her father's obsession and death.
Appears uncomfortable when asked personal questions, indicating some guardedness.
Explains her father's beliefs with respect and defends him against accusations of madness.
Explains historical and archaeological details about Nicolas Flamel confidently and knowledgeably.
Appears uncomfortable when asked a personal question in her office.
Shows deep personal involvement and background related to her field through her father's obsession and her own experiences.
Encourages collaboration by saying 'Let us conquer death together.'
Celebrates funding success with Benji, sharing champagne and clinking glasses.
Smiles wryly and makes a light joke about knowing someone who can read Aramaic.
Explains the significance of the gravestone and the Rose Key clearly and confidently.
Successfully helps raise nearly all the funding needed for the expedition and documentary, showing persistence and focus.
Demonstrates patience and good judgment by waiting a moment before refreshing the funding page again.
Shows resourcefulness by knowing someone who can read Aramaic, a key skill needed for their quest.
Smiles wryly when mentioning she knows someone who can read Aramaic.
Interrupts George's presentation and insists on discussing the era of Nicolas Flamel despite George's clear disinterest and refusal.
Confidently interrupts a public lecture to introduce a complex, obscure topic (Nicolas Flamel era) despite the lecturer's clear reluctance.
Demonstrates knowledge of Aramaic and arranges for expert help, showing resourcefulness.
Admits sheepishly to not letting the lead go dead, showing persistence and honesty.
Tells George she found the Rose Key and asks for his help translating, showing trust and collaboration.
Avoids directly answering George about going to Iran alone, showing some evasiveness.
Finds the Rose Key, a significant artifact, demonstrating successful fieldwork and discovery.
Travels alone to Iran to retrieve the Rose Key despite risks, showing initiative and confidence.
Asks George for help translating Aramaic, recognizing her own limits and seeking expertise.
Responds sheepishly about not letting the lead go dead, indicating persistence and dedication.
Avoids directly answering George’s questions about traveling alone, which could suggest evasiveness or lack of transparency.
Engages eagerly and collaboratively with George to interpret the riddle, showing patience and openness to his explanations.
Questions George’s word choice gently, indicating attentiveness and a desire for clarity without dismissiveness.
Shows excitement and hope about the discovery, sharing the moment with George.
Engages actively in interpreting the riddle, questions wording carefully, and tries to connect clues logically.
Sits unsure about the meaning of a key phrase, showing momentary confusion.
Rushes to find her dad’s notebook and shares important information with George.
Engages collaboratively with George, showing openness and willingness to work together.
Rushes to her dad’s notebook, identifies relevant alchemical information, calculates the depth to the Philosopher’s Stone, and connects historical and symbolic clues.
Asks a practical question about how to get 370 feet into the earth, showing awareness of logistical challenges.
Waves to traffic as she walks through a busy intersection, showing consideration for others' safety.
Takes a breath and tries to play off adrenaline after a car screeches to a stop near her, maintaining composure.
Shares information from her father’s notebook and works collaboratively with George and Benji.
Expresses frustration with George when they discover the catacombs don’t go under Flamel’s grave, showing shared disappointment.

Waves to traffic and walks through a busy intersection while focused on her task, showing confidence but also some risk-taking.
Takes a breath and tries to play off adrenaline after a car screeches to a stop beside her, maintaining composure under stress.
Marks a large map and overlays it with a transparency map to cross-reference locations, demonstrating methodical and analytical thinking.
Stops and steps back to think after realizing the catacombs don’t go under Flamel’s grave, showing reflective and problem-solving behavior.
Chooses to ignore George's distancing comment and insists on a collaborative approach.
Buys three tickets despite George's refusal to join, showing insistence and inclusion.
Challenges George's fear with a teasing remark.
Chooses to ignore George's refusal to collaborate and pushes forward with a plan to burrow through the tunnel.
Identifies the significance of the street collapses and deduces the possibility of a hidden chamber beneath Flamel’s grave.
Insists on buying three tickets despite George's reluctance, demonstrating determination and initiative.
Teases George about not going underground despite being an archaeologist.
Shares information about the catacombs with the camera in an informative and engaging way.
Takes initiative to explore the catacombs by squeezing through a gap and instructing Benji to shine a light.
References her map and identifies a route through the catacombs, showing preparation and knowledge.
Cases the structure carefully, looking for weak points like an inmate looking for weak links in a prison.
Climbs through a small gap in the walls and disappears into darkness, taking initiative and showing confidence.
Encourages Benji to shine a light into the crevasse, demonstrating situational awareness and communication.
Lunges out at the camera to startle Benji, then apologizes.

Thanks the Ticket Taker sincerely and acknowledges his help.

Leads the group confidently to the club despite the unassuming exterior, showing leadership and trust in her information.

Engages Papillon with direct but friendly conversation, using humor and sincerity.
Offers Papillon all the treasure to gain his help, showing generosity and trust.

Encourages George to join the dangerous expedition by appealing to their past teamwork and expressing need for his help.
Offers Papillon the entire treasure, indicating generosity and lack of greed.

Acknowledges the dangers and unknowns of the catacombs, demonstrating realistic assessment of the situation.
Engages actively in planning and discussion with the group, showing involvement and initiative.
Questions the necessity of involving La Taupe, showing skepticism about relying on others.
Follows the group into a dangerous and uncomfortable situation without complaint.
Questions the need for La Taupe despite others insisting on his importance, showing critical thinking.
Follows the group into a dangerous, tight underground space without hesitation, demonstrating courage and readiness.

Appreciates and sincerely compliments the Artist’s work, which the Artist values.

Dismisses Papillon’s experience and George’s caution without fully considering their points.

Determines to go back to save someone despite danger and exhaustion.

Sobbing as she goes, showing vulnerability and emotional openness.
Encourages herself quietly to keep going despite danger and loneliness.

Encourages others to confront their own burdens and join her in a risky leap of faith.

Reassures George despite his doubts, maintaining group morale and confidence in the plan.
